title: What is the rarest car in the world 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Rarest how, by price or production? Money talks, so… Perhaps the 2019 $12.5 Million Bugatti La Voiture Noire One-Off. OR the $70 million sales price (private sale) commanded by a 1963 Ferrari 250 GTO. There were 36 produced, so over $2.5 billion total worth? And, as Bugatti emphasizes, they are quite receptive to producing more “one-off” creations, but perhaps not on-spec. and of course, the previous contenders: Here Are 9 Of The World's Rarest Cars Bugatti Royale Kellner Coupe. Year: 1931. Price: One sold in 1987 for US$9.7 million. ... Koenigsegg CCXR Trevita. Year: 2009. ... JAGUAR XKSS. Year: 1957. ... Helica de Leyat. Year: 1921. ... Rolls-Royce 15 HP. Year: 1904. ... Ferrari 250 GT. Year: 1962. ... Icona Vulcano Titanium. Year: 2013. ... Aston Martin DBR1. Year: 1956. In fact, the list of high prices commanded by “rare” cars is quite long, and boring. List of most expensive cars sold at auction - Wikipedia Perhaps a more interesting list, is the cars that multi-billionaires drive: You Won’t Believe the Cars Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg, and Other Multibillionaires Drive Warren Buffet had to receive a personal sales pitch from the GM CEO to convince him to buy his regular production line common 2014 Cadillac, trading in his 2006 Cadillac. “Buffett doesn’t go for anything super fancy when it comes to his cars. When he got rid of his 2006 Cadillac DTS, he replaced it with a 2014 Cadillac XTS. The car retailed for between $44,600 and $69,095, which is pretty economical for a billionaire. Forbes reported that it was General Motors CEO Mary Barra who convinced Buffett to get the new car, even though his old one was just eight years old and had 19,000 miles. Buffett told Forbes, “She told me about 50 things that were better” about the newest Cadillacs. “By the time we got to lunch — and it’s only 5 or 6 minutes —she sold me.” Buffett had his daughter make the purchase for him, since he was worried that such a rich man wouldn’t get a good price. While Barra had recommended Buffett purchase the Cadillac CTS, he ended up buying the XTS on the advice of the saleswoman in the local dealership. He then donated his old Cadillac to Girls, Inc., a nonprofit working to empower and inspire girls and young women. The organization was able to auction it for $122,500. Getting $122,500 for a used 8-year old regular production line Cadillac. Now that is truly a RARE car! What Cars Does Warren Buffett Own? | MotorBiscuit Follow the money.

There are several cars considered very rare. A lot of manufactures made 1 off cars that were considered concepts. They for the most part were considered what was to come as futuristic. Probably the Bugatti Royale Kathner Coupe would be one with the higher price but I think the 1948 Buick Streamliner would fit the rarest or at least one of the very very rare. I heard we may have lost the last one in the last California fire but I have not been able verify that yet. It was a mid engine straight 8. Check it out.
